DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Subcategory Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether they may participate in a study. EXAMPLE(S): Must be over the age of 18. A coded value specifying a subdivision within a larger category of activities. EXAMPLE(S): chemotherapy, radiotherapy, hormonal therapy, alternative therapy. In the case where categoryCode = "anti-cancer treatment", subcategoryCode may = "radiotherapy", and nameCode may = "external beam radiotherapy". If categoryCode = "Intervention", subcategoryCode may = "Drug" (including placebo), "Device" (including sham), "Biological/Vaccine", "Procedure/Surgery", "Radiation", "Behavioral" (e.g., Psychotherapy, Lifestyle Counseling), "Genetic" (including gene transfer, stem cell and recombinant DNA), Dietary Supplement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Subcategory Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Reference concept defined by a referenced code system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
